entry.title: Unable to find mapping for “LinkToObj” field in OWOR (Production Orders) via SAP Service Layer
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I’m trying to update the field “LinkToObj” in the OWOR (Production Orders) table from “Sales Order” to “Production Order” using the SAP Service Layer with a PUT request.

However, I can’t find any corresponding property or mapping attribute for LinkToObj in the Service Layer metadata or documentation.

Has anyone managed to modify this field through the Service Layer, or know the correct field name or approach to do so?

Thanks in advance for your help!

entry.title: Best practices and process design for using Procurement Type “X” (Make-or-Buy) in SAP ERP
entry.content:
Hello SAP experts,

I’m currently working on a project dealing with the configuration and process implications of using Procurement Type “X” (both in-house and external procurement) for semi-finished and assembly materials in an SAP environment.

Our goal is to understand whether procurement type “X” can be implemented effectively and what process controls and reporting designs are needed to maintain costing accuracy, transparency, and audit compliance,  or whether using two separate material numbers (one for in-house, one for external) is the more sustainable approach.

In our analysis, we have identified advantages (e.g. reduced master data maintenance, simplified BOMs, flexible quota arrangements) and disadvantages (e.g. mixed costing, valuation inconsistencies, transparency and audit concerns, high coordination effort between SCM and Controlling).

I’d like to ask the community for insights or best practices on the following:

  1. Process design:
    What does a clean, transparent process for reconciling in-house and external procurement under procurement type “X” look like, especially regarding communication and data maintenance between SCM and Controlling?

  2. Costing and valuation:
    How do you handle mixed costing or valuation when the in-house/external ratio changes dynamically during the year? Are there SAP-standard functionalities or best-practice workarounds to ensure consistent costing and stock valuation?

  3. Reporting and traceability:
    What reporting setups or SAP tools (standard or custom) are commonly used to analyze internal vs. external shares under procurement type “X”?
    How do you maintain audit-proof transparency in such cases?

  4. Governance and system configuration:
    Are there recommended decision criteria or governance frameworks (e.g. when to use procurement type X vs. separate materials) used in practice to balance flexibility vs. compliance?

I’m particularly interested in learning from companies that successfully implemented procurement type X for Make-or-Buy scenarios without losing control over costing, valuation, and transparency.

Thank you in advance for your insights and experiences!
Best regards!

entry.title: Choosing Between SAP Cloud Private Edition and On-Premise for MM & EWM Certification
entry.content:
I’m an Industrial Engineer and new to the SAP field. I’ve recently completed practical training in SAP MM and am now planning to study for certification. However, I’m unsure whether to focus on the Cloud Private Edition or On-Premise version — both for SAP Sourcing and Procurement and SAP EWM.

Since I’m just starting my SAP career, I’d like to make the right choice based on your professional recommendation, as it will determine my learning and certification path.

In your opinion, which version is better to focus on for building a strong and future-oriented SAP career?

Thank you..

entry.title: Business has by mistake posted the credit memo with less than PO invoice quantity with same
entry.content:
Issue - 

Scenario - PO - 100 price -100 , GR - 100, invoice - quanity - 100, price - 300   by mistake business posted the credit memo for with quantity 30 with price - 300. Now business want the cancel the credit memo which is created incorrectly.  I have tried the cancel the credit memo but it is throughing the error tolerance issue. In Our system tolerance is set up of 250. Can you please suggest how to reverse the credit memo which is incorrectly posted.

I tried to record a script on the PI SHEET of ZZOC-WP using SAP GUI 800, but it didn't seem to record any operation commands. I can record PI sheet script commands using SAP770. Why is this? My Windows system is Win11 Enterprise 23H2, and the SAP client is GUI800_14-80006342_64bit.exe.

entry.title: How to add landed costs to the material cost when freight charges are not known at the time of PO ?
entry.content:
I am trying to understand the correct way to account for landed costs (e.g., freight) in SAP when these charges are not available at the time the purchase order is created. What is the best practice or recommended process in SAP to add the landed costs to the material cost after the PO and goods receipt are already posted, but freight charges are finalized later? Are there any specific configuration steps, transactions, or use of condition types relevant for such scenarios?

Best regards,

Nithin

entry.title: Is a special SAP license required for Power Automate RPA, or is a standard Named User sufficient?
entry.content:
Hi Everyone,

Context : We use Power Automate Desktop (PAD) to automate SAP ECC via SAP GUI Scripting for report export and MB21 posting (GUI only; no API/connector).

Our understanding:

  • Because access is via SAP GUI (direct), the bot should be licensed as a standard SAP Named User (BOT account), not as an SAP “RPA user” and not under Digital/Indirect Access (that would apply if we used non-SAP front-ends/API creating the 9 Digital Access document types).

  • Microsoft licensing is separate: cloud scheduling/unattended would require Power Automate Premium. (Today we’re attended/manual.)

Questions to confirm (please answer Yes/No):

  1. For PAD via SAP GUI, is a special SAP RPA license required? Or is a standard Named User for the BOT account sufficient under our contract?

  2. Which Named User class should we assign to the BOT (Professional vs Limited), given it creates MB21 reservations?

  3. Can we proceed to create a dedicated BOT account (Dialog or Service) with least-privilege roles and restrict GUI Scripting (S_SCR) to this BOT only?

  4. If in the future we switch to API/connector flows, should we then evaluate Digital Access (document-based) separately?

If this looks right, we’ll proceed with a BOT Named User and keep runs attended until any Premium licensing is approved.

Thanks!

Richard

entry.title: Verify database accessing
entry.content:
I got informed by SAP consulting, telling me that oracle database 10.2 running with SAP kernel 721 has the encryption. So that I can not access database directly or access via other way without go to SAP process. As I search from internet, I found the database can be access directly as DB does not have encryption, but it may have SAP Secure Storage (SSFS)  which is in the layer of filesystem.  I understand that it not proper way to do it, but I would like to clarify with SAP consulting. 

Regards,

Pitichai

entry.title: Problem in CV01N with upload *.ZIP File since SAP GUI 8.x. for Windows
entry.content:
The FUB in CV01N (FTP_COMMAND) delivere following information:

Command: put "C:\Temp\TPOP91Re.zip" "/SOFTWARE/xx/BRQ44400000000000000788887"
Answer: C:\Temp\TPOP91Re.zip: not a plain file.

With an older GUI Version the upload work's.

Does anyone know this problem? I cant find any information in SAP Notes.

entry.title: Yield/Remaining Quantity Calculation with BAPI_PRODORDCONF_GET_TT_PROP
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I'm experiencing an issue with the remaining quantity to be confirmed calculation (Yield field/LMNGA) using BAPI_PRODORDCONF_GET_TT_PROP.

Context:

  • Production order with a total quantity of 10 pieces
  • Two operations: 0100 and 0200
  • Operation 0100: 7 pieces confirmed → 3 remaining to be confirmed
  • Operation 0200: 5 pieces confirmed → 5 remaining to be confirmed (theoretically)

When I use BAPI_PRODORDCONF_GET_TT_PROP to retrieve the remaining quantity to be confirmed for operation 0200, it returns 5 pieces.

However, in transaction CO11N, the system correctly displays 2 remaining pieces for operation 0200, as it takes into account the 3 pieces still to be confirmed in the previous operation (0100)...

Is there a parameter or another BAPI that allows me to directly obtain this adjusted value (as in CO11N)? Or do I need to systematically perform this calculation manually by considering the sequence of operations?

I played around with the PROPOSE import parameter of the BAPI, but the quantity result is always 5, maybe I'm missing something.

Thanks in advance for your help!

entry.title: Automatic Replenishment of remaining capacities
entry.content:
Hello all,

could someone help me with the automatic replenishment of remaining capacities for a workday in the tabular planning board in SAP ERP 6.0?

Example: The remaining capacity according to transaction cm50 of capacity type 001 (machine) of some machine on day A is 2 hours, also 2 hours on day B, and 6 hours on day C.

Let's assume that MRP generates a capacity requirement of 12 hours on day D, and the capacity on day D is 20 hours.

Now the challenge: How can I automatically ensure that when SAP draws on the 12-hour capacity requirement of a planned order (created from MRP) on day D, it first uses the remaining capacity from days A, B, and C (i.e., 10 hours total) before drawing the remaining 2 hours from the 20 hours on day D?

Which settings in the strategy profile, workplace, etc., ensure that capacity is always automatically replenished to 100% utilization of a given capacity type?

 

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: project valuation class does not work
entry.content:
Hi there,

I maintained different project valuation class (field QKLAS)  and standard valuation class (field BKLAS ) for certain material in the material master data, the inventory account is different in OBYC-BSX,  also created a project and wbs with valuated stock.

 I create a PO with 2 item using this material,  the 1st item is standard and the 2nd item account assignment category is Q-project and input WBS. However, I found that the 2nd item posted inventory account is the same as standard valuation class after MIGO,  which means system did not use project valuation class for the GR posting.

would any one teach me what is the possible problem? thanks.

Ben

entry.title: Alternative fiori APP for MI23 Display Physical Inventory
entry.content:
Hi

I didn't find any alternative in HANA for MI23.

What I'm looking for is a report with stock in warehouse + Inventory indicator ( which means if the material is counted or not) 

This is a basic requirement to evalualte the accurance of stock in warehouse.

MI23 has this is information but is obsolete ( SAP note) and the extraction in excel it's very bad.

Does someone know a valid and equivalent alternative ? 

BR
